document.masterDocTitle: Neotropical jumping plant-lice (Hemiptera, Psylloidea) associated with plants of the tribe Detarieae (Leguminosae, Detarioideae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Neotropical jumping plant-lice (Hemiptera, Psylloidea) associated with plants of the tribe Detarieae (Leguminosae, Detarioideae)

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Genal processes widely separated medially, axes subparallel; anteorbital tubercle on vertex small, nipple-like ( Fig. 72 , arrow). Forewing slender, 2.6 times as long as broad ( Fig. 74 ). Male and female terminalia as in Figs 81, 90, 91 , 98 . On
Hymenaea ........................................................................................... J. hymenaeae

- Genal processes narrowly separated or almost adpressed medially, axes converging towards apices; anteorbital tubercle on vertex big, flattened ( Fig. 73 , arrow). Forewing broad, 2.1–2.3 times as long as broad ( Fig. 75 ). Terminalia different ( Figs 78–80, 82–89, 92–97, 99, 100 . On
Copaifera
..................................................................... 2

2 Forewing with surface spinules covering most of apical half of wing except for spinule-free stripes along the veins. Sclerotised end tube of ductus ejaculatorius small, originating at base of distal aedeagal segment ( Fig. 85 ). Female subgenital plate long, 0.5–0.6 times as long as proctiger; dorsal outline relatively straight ( Fig. 96 ). Brazil : AC, MT................
J. basifistula

materialsCitation.keyLead:
3 Male proctiger with distinct, relatively small, narrow posterior lobes basally ( Fig. 82 ). Aedeagus indistinctly 3-segmented; distal portion only weakly explanded apically ( Fig. 93 ). Female proctiger straight and truncate apically; subgenital plate with deep, transverse incision subbasally ( Fig. 99 ). Brazil : GO , PI .............................................
J. incisa

paragraph.keyLead:
5 Paramere with subparallel margins, apical sclerotised tooth at the rear corner ( Fig. 88 ). Sclerotised end tube of ductus ejaculatorius less than half as long as distal aedeagal segment ( Fig. 89 ). Female unknown. Brazil : AM................
J. cognata

6 Smaller: antenna <4.0 mm, forewing < 2.5 mm . Male proctiger with slightly angular posterior bulge in basal third ( Fig. 79 ). Paramere relatively broad in apical third, with fewer thick setae on the inner face in apical third ( Fig. 86 ). Basal projection of distal portion of aedeagus small ( Fig. 87 ). Brazil : BA, PI..............................................
J. cearensis

- Larger: antenna> 3.8 mm , forewing> 2.4 mm . Male proctiger with broadly rounded posterior bulge in basal third ( Fig. 83 ). Paramere relatively slender in apical third, with more thick setae on the inner face in apical third ( Fig. 94 ). Basal projection of distal portion of aedeagus large ( Fig. 95 ). Brazil : MG , PR , SP..........................................
J. uncigera

subSubSection.paragraph:
(Immatures of
Jataiba basifistula
,
J. cearensis
,
J. cognata
and
J. incisa
are unknown)

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Antenna 8-segmented. Circumanal ring angular laterally; distance from anus to outer circumanal ring about twice that from there to group of sectasetae ( Fig. 102 ). On
Hymenaea
..............................................
J. hymenaeae

- Antenna 7-segmented. Circumanal ring rounded laterally; distance from anus to outer circumanal ring about the same as that from there to group of sectasetae ( Fig. 103 ). On
Copaifera
............................................
J. uncigera
